page.title: 04Economics
page.content: We interviewed the Midland Bank manager in Shenstone. Business is fairly good in Shenstone said mr Weetman. The bank deals with about 100,000 pounds a week. On mondays and fridays nine people work in the bank. Each week about 800 people use the bank and 20 people under the age of 16. The Sercuricor van comes about 2 or 3 times a week. The bank has never been broken into. We asked him what his main ambition is and he said that he wanted to keep fit when he retires and play golf in his spare time. He showed us the safe which is a big room with bars in the doorway at night they put a big door over the bars of the safe and lock it up. The bank was a shop before it was turned into a bank in 1963. A.BEARD & K.HAWTHORN
